intro: Austrobassia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bennettia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry conditions of its habitat. Austrobassia parviflora is often found in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
